title: President, PM express condolences over death of Mumtaz Bhutto
content:
ISLAMABAD, July 18 (APP): President Dr Arif Alvi and Prime Minister Imran Khan Sunday expressed their grief and condolences over the death of Mumtaz Ali Bhutto, former governor Sindh.
They expressed sympathies with the bereaved family and also prayed for the departed soul and for the family to bear the loss with equanimity.
On his twitter handle, the prime minister posted, “Saddened to hear of the passing of Sardar Mumtaz Ali Bhutto. My condolences and prayers go to his family”.
Saddened to hear of the passing of Sardar Mumtaz Ali Bhutto. My condolences and prayers go to his family.
— Imran Khan (@ImranKhanPTI) July 18, 2021
Mumtaz Bhutto, 94, a cousin and close aide of former prime minister and PPP founder late Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, breathed his last on Sunday at his residence in Karachi.
Late Mumtaz Bhutto had served as governor Sindh during 1971 and then as provincial chief minister in 1972.
